title: Virtual Talk: Love of Bronze—The Works of Richard Hunt
hero_caption: Richard Hunt. Scholar’s Rock or Stone of Hope or Love of Bronze, 2014–2020. Image courtesy of the artist.
short_description:
Join educator Nancy Chen for a conversation exploring the work of Chicago-based artist Richard Hunt, featured in the current exhibition Richard Hunt: Scholar’s Rock or Stone of Hope or Love of Bronze.

An alumnus of the School of the Art Institute who graduated in 1957, Hunt describes his sculpture as a form of improvisation, an unfolding dialogue “between me, the technique, and the material.” His work is In order to allow for conversation and exchange, capacity for this program is limited.
list_description: Explore the improvisational sculptures of Chicago-based artist Richard Hunt.
description:
Join educator Nancy Chen for a conversation exploring the work of Chicago-based artist Richard Hunt, featured in the current exhibition Richard Hunt: Scholar’s Rock or Stone of Hope or Love of Bronze. An alumnus of the School of the Art Institute who graduated in 1957, Hunt describes his sculpture as a form of improvisation, an unfolding dialogue “between me, the technique, and the material.”

In order to allow for conversation and exchange, capacity for this program is limited.

This virtual event will be hosted on Zoom. Find Zoom tutorials and resources here. If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.
